CRI.reason: High CRI is essential for color-sensitive activities like drawing and learning objects.
CRI.recommendation: Use LEDs with CRI ≥90 in art and play zones.

CRI.reason: Moderate CRI may be acceptable for general lighting.
CRI.recommendation: Use ≥80 CRI in shared areas but prioritize higher CRI in activity zones.

CRI.reason: Poor color accuracy can impair visual development and reduce engagement.
CRI.recommendation: Avoid low-CRI fixtures; ensure color accuracy for young learners.

CCT.reason: Warm light creates a comforting and calm environment, supporting emotional security.
CCT.recommendation: Install warm-white LEDs in nurseries and playrooms.

CCT.reason: Neutral tones are acceptable but not ideal for early development.
CCT.recommendation: Use with dimming in active zones only.

CCT.reason: Cool light may overstimulate young children and disrupt rest patterns.
CCT.recommendation: Avoid cool CCT in preschool areas; use warmer tones instead.

Lux.reason: Ensures sufficient brightness for play without causing overstimulation.
Lux.recommendation: Use general lighting plus dimmable zones for naps and quiet time.

Lux.reason: May be suitable for quiet or nap areas.
Lux.recommendation: Use soft lighting in nap zones or indirect corners.

Lux.reason: Too dim lighting hinders visual growth and safe movement.
Lux.recommendation: Maintain minimum lighting of 300 lux in active areas.

UGR.reason: Minimizes visual discomfort for sensitive young eyes.
UGR.recommendation: Use fixtures with diffusers and avoid direct beam paths.

UGR.reason: Acceptable for brief exposure but not ideal.
UGR.recommendation: Limit exposure in active learning zones.

UGR.reason: High glare increases distraction and may affect behavior.
UGR.recommendation: Use matte surfaces and indirect light fixtures.

Flicker.reason: Flicker-free lighting prevents headaches and overstimulation in sensitive young children.
Flicker.recommendation: Use flicker-free LED drivers, especially in special needs or nap zones.

Flicker.reason: Mild flicker may be tolerable but not recommended.
Flicker.recommendation: Use with caution and monitor student feedback.

Flicker.reason: Visible flicker can increase hyperactivity and discomfort.
Flicker.recommendation: Avoid budget LEDs with unstable drivers.

Uniformity.reason: Ensures even lighting across play and learning areas.
Uniformity.recommendation: Design layout with consistent lux across all child-accessible zones.

Uniformity.reason: Acceptable in corridors or secondary spaces.
Uniformity.recommendation: Improve lighting for main play areas.

Uniformity.reason: Uneven lighting causes confusion and discomfort.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: Supports circadian rhythm alignment and sleep cycle stability.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Use dynamic white lighting to match morning/day cycles.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Helps young children perceive facial cues and vertical surfaces.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Ensure soft uplight or wall washers to enhance facial recognition.
Use reflective surfaces and ambient bounce light.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Inhibits recognition of expressions and wall-mounted materials.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Add vertical lighting in play and instruction areas.

Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Use dimmable lighting with natural daylight rhythms.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Some benefit but less impact on mood regulation.
Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Extend exposure time especially in morning.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Too short to affect biological rhythm.
Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Increase lighting exposure during core hours.

CRI.reason: Accurate color rendering helps with learning and visual comfort.
CRI.recommendation: Use CRI above 80 in primary school classrooms.

CCT.reason: Cooler white light can increase alertness and attention span.

Lux.reason: Sufficient brightness improves reading and concentration.

UGR.reason: UGR < 19 is appropriate for prolonged reading and writing.
UGR.recommendation: UGR should be below 19 in classrooms.

Flicker.reason: Low flicker supports visual comfort and concentration.

Uniformity.reason: Uniform light distribution reduces eye strain during study.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: Melanopic light helps maintain attention and circadian balance.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Ensure 200–300 lux melanopic EDI in morning sessions.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Enhances student engagement and facial visibility.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Balanced light exposure promotes healthy sleep patterns.

CRI.reason: Maintains accurate color discrimination and professional task performance.
CRI.recommendation: Use CRI > 80 in adult learning or work environments.

CCT.reason: Cool white light enhances focus and productivity.
CCT.recommendation: Use CCT between 4000K and 6500K for alertness.

Lux.reason: Higher illuminance helps maintain visual acuity during prolonged tasks.

UGR.reason: Reduces glare discomfort in visually intensive tasks.

Flicker.reason: Reduces eye fatigue during long periods of screen use or reading.

Uniformity.reason: Consistent lighting improves overall comfort and reduces errors.

Melanopic_EDI.reason: Stimulates alertness and maintains circadian rhythm in adults.
Melanopic_EDI.recommendation: Ensure 250–400 lux melanopic EDI during work hours.

Vertical_Illuminance.reason: Supports facial interaction and visual ergonomics.
Vertical_Illuminance.recommendation: Vertical illuminance should range from 200–300 lux.

Exposure_Duration.reason: Sustained exposure needed to regulate adult circadian function.
Exposure_Duration.recommendation: Provide exposure for 1–4 hours depending on task timing.
